description: Stat-Xplore allows you to download and customise Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) statistics.

attachments.title: user guide to HBAI data on Stat-Xplore
user guide to Pensioners’ Incomes Series (PI) data on Stat-Xplore

details.body:
Stat-Xplore

Stat-Xplore is an online tool, it holds statistics on:

  • Alternative Claimant Count
  • Attendance Allowance (AA)
  • Benefit Cap
  • Benefit Combinations
  • Bereavement Benefits
  • Bereavement Support Payment
  • Carer’s Allowance (CA)
  • Child Maintenance Service
  • Children in Low Income Families
  • Disability Living Allowance (DLA)
  • Employment and Support Allowance (ESA)
  • ESA Work Capability Assessments
  • Fraud and Error in the benefit system
  • Households below average income (HBAI)
  • Housing Benefit (HB)
  • Incapacity Benefit (IB) and Severe Disablement Allowance (SDA)
  • Income Support (IS)
  • Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit (IIDB)
  • Jobseeker’s Allowance (JSA)
  • National Insurance number allocations to adult overseas nationals
  • Pension Credit
  • Pensioner Income
  • Personal Independence Payment (PIP)
  • Population Estimates
  • sanction decisions for ESA, Income Support (IS), Jobseeker’s Allowance (JSA) and Universal Credit
  • State Pension
  • Support for Mortgage Interest
  • Universal Credit
  • Widow’s Benefit
  • Work and Health Programme
  • Work Programme

You can use Stat-Xplore to:

  • create customised tabulations
  • view results in interactive charts
  • share outputs via social networking tools or download into common file formats

We welcome views on Stat-Xplore from our users. Please contact stat.xplore@dwp.gov.uk with feedback and queries on Stat-Xplore.

Stat-Xplore user guides

The following Stat-Xplore user guides are available:

  • user guide to Universal Credit Official Statistics: Stat-Xplore

  • user guide to Family Resources Survey (FRS) data

  • user guide to Households below average income (HBAI) data

  • user guide to Industrial Injuries Disablement Benefit (IIDB) data

  • user guide to Pensioners’ Incomes Series (PI) data

change_history.note: Added link to Universal Credit Official Statistics: Stat-Xplore user guide.
Page updated and information added about NOMIS.
Added households below average income (HBAI) to the list of statistics now available on Stat-Xplore.
